documentedSymbols.description: - Initial release with complete Express.js framework - Dynamic model registry system - JWT authentication and RBAC - Multi-language i18n support - Comprehensive service layer - Database initialization utilities

examples.code:
npm install @digitaldefiance/node-express-suite
# or
yarn add @digitaldefiance/node-express-suite

# Run all tests
npm test

# Run specific test suites
npm test -- database-initialization.spec.ts
npm test -- jwt.spec.ts
npm test -- role.spec.ts

# Run with coverage
npm test -- --coverage

npm install -D @faker-js/faker
# or
yarn add -D @faker-js/faker

const config = getExpressRuntimeConfiguration();
   const hashedPassword = await bcrypt.hash(password, config.BcryptRounds);

userSchema.index({ email: 1 }, { unique: true });
   userSchema.index({ username: 1 }, { unique: true });

RouteBuilder.create()
  .post('/register')
  .auth()
  .validate(validation)
  .transaction()
  .handle(this.register);

class Application<T, I, TInitResults, TModelDocs, TBaseDocument, TEnvironment, TConstants, TAppRouter>
class UserController<I, D, S, A, TUser, TTokenRole, TTokenUser, TApplication, TLanguage>

class Application  // No generic parameters
class UserController<TConfig extends ControllerConfig, TLanguage>

npm install @digitaldefiance/node-express-suite@^2.0.0
# or
yarn add @digitaldefiance/node-express-suite@^2.0.0

# Find
new JwtService(app)
# Replace with
app.services.get(ServiceKeys.JWT)

# Find
new UserService(app)
# Replace with
app.services.get(ServiceKeys.USER)

# Run full test suite
npm test

# Run specific controller tests
npm test -- user-controller.spec.ts

# Check for deprecation warnings
DEBUG=* npm start

documentedSymbols.name: Framework
documentedSymbols.description: `@digitaldefiance/suite-core-lib` offers the essential **core primitives and abstractions** that power: - Secure user accounts and authentication mechanisms - End-to-end encryption between users and servers - Zero-knowledge proof based authentication flows - Role-based access control (RBAC) with fine-grained permissions - Multi-language internationalization (i18n) with plugin-based architecture

documentedSymbols.name: Ecosystem
documentedSymbols.description: `@digitaldefiance/suite-core-lib` offers the essential **core primitives and abstractions** that power: - Secure user accounts and authentication mechanisms - End-to-end encryption between users and servers - Zero-knowledge proof based authentication flows - Role-based access control (RBAC) with fine-grained permissions - Multi-language internationalization (i18n) with plugin-based architecture

documentedSymbols.name: Internationalization
documentedSymbols.description: This library includes built-in support for **five major languages** using a modern plugin-based i18n architecture: - **English** (US and UK variants) - **French** - **Spanish** - **Mandarin Chinese** - **Ukrainian** All error messages, validation texts, and user-facing strings are fully localized and designed to be extensible for additional languages.

documentedSymbols.name: Runtime
documentedSymbols.description: This package uses a runtime configuration registry for all constants and cryptographic parameters. You can override defaults at runtime for advanced use cases: All constants are immutable and accessible via the registry/config API. See `src/constants.ts` and `src/defaults.ts` for more information.

documentedSymbols.name: Type
documentedSymbols.description: This release focuses on improving type safety by removing unsafe type casts and implementing proper type constraints.

documentedSymbols.name: Safety
documentedSymbols.description: This release focuses on improving type safety by removing unsafe type casts and implementing proper type constraints.

documentedSymbols.name: Improvements
documentedSymbols.description: This release focuses on improving type safety by removing unsafe type casts and implementing proper type constraints.

documentedSymbols.name: Cloneable
documentedSymbols.description: - Added `Cloneable` type union to constrain deep clone operations

documentedSymbols.name: deepFreeze
documentedSymbols.description: - Removed `(obj as any)[prop]` cast from `deepFreeze` function

documentedSymbols.name: applyOverrides
documentedSymbols.description: - Removed `(result as any)[key]` cast from `applyOverrides` function

documentedSymbols.name: TranslatableSuiteError
documentedSymbols.description: - Removed unnecessary `language as any` cast in `TranslatableSuiteError`

documentedSymbols.name: translate
documentedSymbols.description: - The i18n engine's `translate` method already accepts `language?: string`

documentedSymbols.name: Changes
documentedSymbols.description: 1. **Deep Clone Improvements** - Added `Cloneable` type union to constrain deep clone operations - Removed `as unknown as T` casts from array and object cloning - Improved type safety for RegExp and Date cloning 2. **Dynamic Property Access** - Removed `(obj as any)[prop]` cast from `deepFreeze` function - Added proper type handling for object property access - Removed `(result as any)[key]` cast from `applyOverrides` function 3. **Translation Error Handling** - Removed unnecessary `language as any` cast in `TranslatableSuiteError` - The i18n engine's `translate` method already accepts `language?: string`

documentedSymbols.name: Type
documentedSymbols.description: - **Before**: 5 instances of unsafe type casts - **After**: 2 controlled type conversions in well-defined functions - **Improvement**: 60% reduction in type safety escape hatches

documentedSymbols.name: IBackendUserRole
documentedSymbols.description: - Update backend interfaces (`IBackendUser`, `IBackendUserRole`, `IBackendTokenRole`, `IBackendUsedDirectLoginToken`) to support generic ID types (defaulting to `Types.ObjectId` for backward compatibility). This enables support for pluggable ID providers (e.g. GUIDs, strings, numbers) introduced in `@digitaldefiance/ecies-lib` v4.1.0.

documentedSymbols.name: IBackendTokenRole
documentedSymbols.description: - Update backend interfaces (`IBackendUser`, `IBackendUserRole`, `IBackendTokenRole`, `IBackendUsedDirectLoginToken`) to support generic ID types (defaulting to `Types.ObjectId` for backward compatibility). This enables support for pluggable ID providers (e.g. GUIDs, strings, numbers) introduced in `@digitaldefiance/ecies-lib` v4.1.0.

documentedSymbols.name: IBackendUsedDirectLoginToken
documentedSymbols.description: - Update backend interfaces (`IBackendUser`, `IBackendUserRole`, `IBackendTokenRole`, `IBackendUsedDirectLoginToken`) to support generic ID types (defaulting to `Types.ObjectId` for backward compatibility). This enables support for pluggable ID providers (e.g. GUIDs, strings, numbers) introduced in `@digitaldefiance/ecies-lib` v4.1.0.

documentedSymbols.name: New

documentedSymbols.name: Features
documentedSymbols.description: - **Builders Module**: UserBuilder, RoleBuilder with fluent APIs - **Core Module**: Result<T,E> pattern, type exports, error exports - **Lib Module**: Validators, formatters, custom constants support - **Custom Constants**: `createValidators(constants)` for flexible validation rules

documentedSymbols.name: Initial
documentedSymbols.description: - Sun Oct 12 2025 13:26:37 GMT-0700 (Pacific Daylight Time) - Initial release of `@digitaldefiance/suite-core-lib` with core user management primitives, type-safe interfaces, secure backup code system, localized error handling, and multi-language support.

examples.code:
npm install @digitaldefiance/suite-core-lib
# or
yarn add @digitaldefiance/suite-core-lib

# Run the comprehensive test suite
yarn test

# 409 tests covering:
#  Type safety and interface validation
#  Cryptographic security functions  
#  Multi-language localization
#  Error handling and edge cases
#  Integration scenarios
#  Builders and fluent APIs
#  Result pattern and core utilities
#  Validators with custom constants
